data.mission: Consolidate and synthesize recent cognitive work, research findings, and insights into a comprehensive knowledge report. Review accumulated thoughts, agent findings, and memory patterns to identify key themes, connections, and knowledge gaps.

Design a rigorous within-subject, multimodal experimental and analysis plan to map and compare neural/cognitive networks supporting creative production versus aesthetic appreciation across visual art and music, including co-creative (humanâ€“AI) dyadic paradigms and longitudinal learning/transfer components. Produce task-matched behavioral paradigms, imaging contrasts (fMRI/EEG), representational similarity analysis pipelines, and dyadic neuroimaging schemes (simultaneous or sequential) that will allow testing of overlap vs dissociation and effects of AI collaboration on network recruitment and motivation.

Run runtime/outputs/tools/run_outputs_qa.py (or validate_outputs.py) with verbose logging; ensure it writes deterministic artifacts under /outputs/qa/ and capture a console transcript for reproducibility.

Implement a preflight smoke-test step in the canonical QA runner that always writes /outputs/qa/logs/<timestamp>_smoke_test.log (python version, imports, filesystem write check) and fails fast if it cannot write artifacts.

Run `init_outputs.py` and `validate_outputs.py` via the canonical entrypoint; capture stdout/stderr to `/outputs/qa/logs/<timestamp>_{init,validate}.log` and write a concise summary to `/outputs/qa/reports/<timestamp>_summary.md` with exit codes and key assertions.

Patch the QA runner to detect container loss and automatically switch to a 'failsafe execution mode' that (1) runs only non-container checks, (2) captures full diagnostics, and (3) emits a standardized failure report to /outputs/qa/.

Create a single command (e.g., run_outputs_qa) that orchestrates steps (a)-(f) and writes one normalized report artifact (plus machine-readable JSON) under /outputs/qa/ with a stable filename convention.
